column9: First off, I hope that everybody who is unsure whether or not they want to take Provera will read this. I say TRY IT! If you have the prescription, give it a try, it is not a experimental drug. It has worked and continued to work for a verity of women with a verity of problems.I was sort of hesitant at first to writing a review, but I felt like I had to, hopefully this helps some of you. You might be scared like I was at first after sitting here for hours reading every comment about Provera. I had not had a period for about 2 and a half years. Come to find out I have PCOS. I am married for almost 4 years and we have been TTC ever since we got married. We were never expecting that I could have PCOS. My gynecologist gave me a prescription for Provera so i will be able to tell the Reproductive Endocrinologist I'm schedule to see next Monday if I had the breakthrough bleeding. Again I remind you I did NOT have a period for 2 1/2 years, I was give 10mg for 12day, I know its usually 10 days but I guess its been soo long she gave me 12 days, by the 10Th day, I was spotting! I made my husband take me to the zoo (for a day of great quality time and so I could take a nice long walk because even after so long of no period I was still able to tell it was going to come) I got in a 1 1/2 hour walk because I know its good to get a  flow going. Here I am only 7 days after finishing Provera, with a normal constant flow, not too heavy. No horrible symptoms before or after taking it other than normal period symptoms. column9: I was placed on this medicine due to no period for 8 months. I got pregnant in Dec 2008, had a miscarriage in March 2009, and 6 months later, in Aug 2009, still no period. My doctor gave me 10 pills, 10 mg. I took them at night bc it made me VERY sleepy/drowsy.  I was told that I'd start my period within the first 10 days of coming off Provera, typically between days 3-7.  My last pill was Thursday night, and I started spotting that Saturday afternoon. I spotted the rest of the weekend, with my "period" coming on Monday. I called my Dr to see what day I should count as Day 1 of my cycle, and she said to count that Saturday as Day 1. She said any bleeding/spotting on Provera (after the last pill) is considered a period, to count that first day as Day 1. I start taking Clomid on Day 5, to get me ovulating, hoping to get pregnant again.  The only real side effects I had was a slight inability to concentrate as much, hot flashes & cramping (which was probably due to my period getting ready to come) and like I mentioned, it made me very sleepy when I took it, so I recommend taking it at night.  Overall, I'm very satisfied with Provera. It made me have a period, just like it supposed to. Now I move on to the next step, taking 50mg of Clomid for 5 days. Hope this gets me pregnant again! Good luck to you ladies and I hope your experience is as good as mine was.
